result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Waite was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

10:34 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #2, 3, 4, 5, 6   .
 Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #      1
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 9 months in the DCJ, with Huber 

-Stayed for 2 years probation cc to 20CM2376, 21CM845

CONDITIONS:

-No threats/acts of violence against: NMR
-Certified DV treatment
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-DNA on file
-Defendant not to use or possess any weapon 
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
-DA surcharge
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge, DA surcharge due on probation 

-Days credit if revoked: 1

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC

Casee T

Status conference on March 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on March 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Memorandum in support to consolidate cases for trial and admission of other acts
Status conference on March 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cases 20CM2376 and 22CM33. Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Cuevas speaks to new case, he has not yet been appointed to.  Asking that all cases be set together.  CT: will still be moving cases forward, defendant is to go to SPD to apply for his newest case.  ADA Al-Homsi: plans on filing a joinder motion on cases, would like a deadline for that motion, as that is the only way he can get desk time to write motion.  Court puts due day of motion to 2/18/2022.  Atty. Cuevas requests trial dates be moved.  Court is leaving trial dates for now.  Court also gives other deadline for evidentiary motion must be filed by 3/15/22.
Status conference on February 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Nicole R. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 12 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:13 AM Defendant appeared.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
